title: Knowledge
content: One of the attributes of God (
). Knowledge of divine and spiritual things is absolutely essential for one’s salvation; hence the gospel is to be taught to every soul. “How shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard?” (
). Knowledge is not obtained all at once, even by revelation, but line upon line, precept upon precept (
). The scriptures, and also living prophets, are given so that the people might have knowledge of things of God and “know how to worship, and know what you worship” (
). Knowledge is one of the endowments of the Holy Ghost (
) and one of the gifts of the Spirit (
). Peter lists knowledge along with faith, patience, kindness, and virtue as necessary acquisitions for one who would seek for a divine nature (
). Since no one can be saved in ignorance of the gospel (
), and one progresses only as fast as he gains knowledge (
4:588), it follows that the person who gains knowledge will have “the advantage in the world to come” (
